info.name: Uncheckered
info.attribution:
This is an original game by Michael Taylor and Anna Taylor, copyright 2024. Logo design by Steel Phoenix Design Studio and trademarked by Michael Taylor and Anna Taylor. This game is licensed for use on virtualtabletop.io.

To purchase a physical copy of the game, visit our store at https://www.uncheckered.com or buy on Amazon at https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DKGDFDWV.
info.description: Uncheckered is an innovative strategy game that adds a new dimension to two-player classic board games. Maneuver your dice and capture your opponents to control the board and clear a path to victory. Whats the catch? Dice only jump lower valued dice, and you can merge two to increase one's value. It's simple to learn, but hard to master. Discover a new world of strategy with Uncheckered!
info.ruleText:
Game Setup:
The board is already set up. Choose a color and press the restart button to select a random starting player.

Objective:

Be the first player with a  in the row farthest from the player (the opponent's home row).

Gameplay:

              Players take turns choosing a die to either:

              • Capture. A player must capture by jumping if possible to do so.
              • Move. Move a die one square diagonally.
              • Promote. Combine two of their own dice or use the center square.

              Capture

              • A player must capture when available and keep capturing until no longer possible. If there are multiple capture options, the player whose turn it can choose which capture to make.
              • Capture an adjacent opponents die by jumping over it in a straight diagonal line and landing in the empty square on the other side. Immediately remove captured dice from play.
              • The value of the dice determine whether a capture is possible:
                • A die can only capture if its value is higher than the die being captured.
                • Exceptions:
                  • A  cannot be captured and cannot capture a .
                  • A  can be captured by any other die and cannot make captures.
                • For example:
                • 's can capture a , , , or .
                • 's can capture a or .
              • A player must capture when possible and must keep capturing until a capture is not possible. The player chooses which capture to make among multiple possible capture options.
              Red must either use the  to jump the blue  and then , or use the red  to jump the blue  in the image above.
              Blue (moving downward in the image above) cannot capture any of the red dice.

              Move

              • Move a die diagonally to the next adjacent empty dark square.
              • , , , or  can only move forward (towards the opponent's home row).
              •  and  can move either backward or forward.
              • Note: a player may make valid moves into and out of the opponent's home row.

              Blue can move the  forward (down in the image above) or the  in either direction.
              Red cannot move the  forward (up in the image above) into the occupied spaces and cannot move backward.

              Promote

              Promote a die to change its value by using the center square or by combining two dice.

                  • Center square:
                    • One time per game, each player may promote a die one value higher by moving it into the empty center square.
                    • Promoting in the center square cannot occur simultaneously with capture.
                    • The player must make the decision to use the center square for promotion when the die is moved.
                  • Combining:
                    • Players combine two of their own dice by making a valid move with one die into an adjacent diagonal square occupied by another of their own dice.
                    • Remove the die that moved from the board. Change the value of the remaining die to the sum of combined dice.
                  • For both methods, if the value of the new die exceeds six, subtract six from the result. For example, if a  and  combine, the result is a  (3 + 4 - 6).
                  In the image above, red can combine the  with the  by moving the  forward. The  becomes a  and the  is removed. The  cannot promote backward. Red can move the  forward or the  backwards to make to a .

                  Winning:

                  • The first player to move or promote a die to a  on any of the dark squares in the opponent's home row is the winner.
                  • The game ends if and when both players cannot get a  in the opponent's home row:
                    • The player with the lowest sum of all the face up pips on their dice wins.
                    • If the sums of the pips are the same, the player with the most remaining dice on the board wins.
                    • If still tied, the victory is shared.
                  Variant Play:

                  Start with a  instead of a . Players cannot make another . To win, move the  to the opponent's home row, capture the opponent's , or prevent the opponent from making a valid play.
info.helpText:
Players select and click on a seat.

Click the restart button (upper right) to begin and a player is chosen at random to start. Click the settings button (upper right) to play with the variation rules, change the orientation of the board, or allow for rules enforcement and automation to be turned off.

To play, click on a die. The valid moves will be displayed on the screen. If a jump is required, the valid squares will already be displayed after the other player's turn ends. Click on the square to move the die.

When moving into the center square, select the large black and white plus sign to promote the die or the X button to close the overlay and not promote.

If needed, press the turn button (lower right) to change the turn.

If needed, press the undo button (lower left) to go back one move per click.

Limitation of automation:
  • The game does not recognize when the game ends due to a tie-breaker rule going into effect. As soon as neither player can make a 6, manually determine the winner by looking at the tie-breaker rules.
